intro: Asperula lutea subsp. oetaea, commonly known as the Oetaea azalea, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces clusters of showy, yellow-orange flowers during the spring season. Its leaves are typically dark green, glossy, and oval in shape. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
